page.title: 03Growth of Gnosall
page.content: The settlement of the village of Gnosall has grown up in two parts on either side of Doley Brook where the land was marshy. To the NE is Gnosall and to the SE is Gnosall Heath. The population of Gnosall has grown rapidly in recent years and it is now thought to be the largest village in England. Recent population growth: 1951 2098 1961 2482 1971 3235 1981 4767 Derivation of place-names In Gnosall there is a wide variety of place-names. We tried to find some out. Broadhill means a wide hill. Heathway is where the heath was and they made a pathway. Cowley stands for cows' meadow. Ley means meadow. Beffcote means cattle shelter. Beff means beef and cote means shelter.
